root.title: Other Learning Paradigms
root.content:
Other Learning Paradigms

Beyond supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning, other paradigms have emerged to tackle different types of problems.

quiz.question: Which learning paradigm is most useful when you have a large amount of data, but only a small portion of it is labeled?

semi-supervised.title: Semi-Supervised Learning
semi-supervised.content:
Semi-Supervised Learning

This approach is a middle ground between supervised and unsupervised learning, using a small amount of labeled data and a large amount of unlabeled data for training. It's useful when labeling data is expensive.

self-supervised.title: Self-Supervised Learning
self-supervised.content:
Self-Supervised Learning

A type of unsupervised learning where the data provides the supervision. The model learns to predict a part of its input from other parts of its input. This is foundational to large language models (LLMs).

transfer-learning.title: Transfer Learning
transfer-learning.content:
Transfer Learning

A powerful technique where a model developed for a task is reused as the starting point for a model on a second task. It's very popular in deep learning, as it can reduce the need for massive datasets.

quiz.question: What is the main benefit of Transfer Learning?
options: It creates the most accurate models from scratch.
It only works for image recognition.
quiz.answer: It allows a model to be trained on a new task with less data.
